original_title: Sri Lanka central bank tightens related party loans by banks
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s central bank has issued rules limiting loans that can be granted by commercial banks to directors, their relatives, partners, chief executives, senior executives, companies with connections such individuals and shareholders.
Loans to individuals have been limited to 20 million rupees. Loans to related companies have been limited to 10 percent of equity or 15 percent in other cases.
